newsitem.title: FRANCE: French Communist rail workers join Oct 17 strike.
newsitem.headline: French Communist rail workers join Oct 17 strike.

text.p: The railways section of Communist-led trades union CGT on Wednesday called a strike on October 17 as part of a day of public sector action against government austerity policies.
CGT said the action would take place from 1800 GMT on October 16 to 1600 GMT on October 18.
The CGT said that SNCF management and the government were slow in putting in place the accords concluded after a wave of public transports strikes last autumn.
It said it blamed management for "reactivating its job reduction policy, reorganisations... and for openly publising its wish to consider suspending the accords obtained in 1995".
Rail workers belonging to the Force Ouvriere union and the pro-Socialist CFDT had already decided to join the October 17 strike, the same day that civil service employees stage a one- day stoppage.
